intro: Borreria miegei, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria miegei is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
